headline: Finally, someone is spending millions to get more Arizona Latinos to vote
author: Elvia Díaz
sentences: Yet that amount is a drop in the bucket, considering that candidates and their supporters are expected to spend hundreds of millions of dollars combined in the war to control Congress and the state Legislature.

That makes Chicanos por la Causa’s $10 million even more impressive and important in Arizona, where Latinos are the fastest-growing segment of the population, accounting for a third of the state’s residents.

Chicanos por La Causa, one of the largest Latino nonprofit organizations in the nation, will spend $10 million to encourage Arizona’s 1.2 million Hispanics eligible to vote to do so.
But as I’ve asked before, why do candidates and political parties expect Latinos to show up if they only spend a few dollars and they do it in the final days of the election cycle?
Border security, the current hot-button issue among politicians fighting for conservative votes, is important to some Latinos, especially those flocking to the Republican Party.
“It’s very liberating,” Joseph Garcia, CPLC’s vice president of public policy, said of the decision to spend that much reaching out to Latinos this year.
Garcia notes how Latinos have proven crucial in tight races, such as Kelly’s and President Joe Biden’s, who won Arizona by less than 10,000 votes.
Some are recent immigrants who speak only Spanish, but others have lived here for generations, dating back to when Arizona was Mexican territory.
And neither Kelly nor his Republican opponents – or anyone else, for that matter – has committed multimillion-dollar amounts to court Latinos.
But it’s also true that Hispanics have generally underperformed at the polls because hardly anyone explains to them what’s at stake.
But candidates and their political parties – Republicans and Democrats – ought to know they ignore Latinos at their own peril.
It’ll be a nonpartisan effort that, when combined with the work of other groups, could have significant impact in key races.
